page.title: 02Wingate - Spoil heap
page.content: For almost a hundred years the {colliery waste heap}dominated the landscape of the village. It could be seen from the window of almost every house. To the outsider it was{ugly, {dirty}and a{blot on the landscape. About two hundred feet high and{the {shape of a volcano,}it was a symbol of security and a reminder of years of struggle and hard work. It was unbelievable that it could ever change. {A model appeared}in the local community centre. It showed{Wingate {with no spoil heap,}just grassland and a recreation area. It looked strange, {reaction was mixed.}Some liked the new Wingate, many liked it the way it was. Authority had decided, however, and for six months{giant earth movers covered Wingate in a{thick layer of {dust.}Maybe the outsiders are happy.
